posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
You make your levelling unecessary hard.
Weapon Finesse at lvl3. Always.
Dodge and Mobility must be taken in time for SD. So 1 and 6, WF at 9 for CoT. Then start building you dual-wield. Don't bother with Exotic, in this one daggers will be fine and dandy. Not sure about IC, if you got room, then sure. No biggie.

Going Rogue12/SD1/CoT7 pre-epic should get you enough feats, I think? To save 3 CoT levels for Epics to get you EWF and most likely Epic Prowess. You don't need SD beyond HIPS. Get Epic Dodge at lvl 27. It's THE dexer feat.
For the SC-line of feats. Remember that when going against people with Blind Fight, SCV is twice as good as SCIV. Epic Dodge is better than the whole line. Those are my levelling tips for now. You'll end up pretty much the same, except for far worse crit range but way more damage still. End split would be Rogue29/SD1/CoT10.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
I wonder if he went CoT15 for a different damage type against sneak immune bosses?

Also, you have improved expertise but no expertise. In an ED/SCV build, you shouldn’t need either, unless there’s something unique to Nordock.

Grab Epic Dodge at level 27. Game changer.

I’d drop improved crit. Grimnir’s pre-epic split is good. But if you want 1 more AB, try Rogue12/CoT8, and still have two cot feats for epic. And then take SD at level 21.

You have 32 dex in attributes, but 34 in level guide.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You have Improved Critical twice.  Also, it is generally a good idea to take Blind Fight as early as possible, which for this build is unfortunately still as late as level 12.  So, I would shuffle the feats like this:
12 Blind Fight
13 Two Weapon Fighting
14 Ambidexterity
15 Improved TWF, Improved Crit.
16
17 *something else* (In alphabetical order: Called Shot, Knockdown, or Weapon Focus for a ranged weapon or Shortsword)
Note: If you take Knockdown at level 17, you will need Improved Knockdown at level 18 because of your small size.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'd agree with Empyre on his breakdown, except that you won't have a feat (neither bonus - it's CoT 3 - nor general) at level 14, and would go further and recommend Knockdown and Improved Knockdown instead of Toughness and Improved Critical. You'll be using Sneak Attack a lot, and knocking folk over first will help a lot with that, while your defences are good enough not to need the extra hit points and, while I'm a great fan of Imp Crit, IKD would be more useful, I believe. But it's your call.

EDIT: Oh, and I think you're understating your AB. You have a BAB of 26, and a Dex bonus of +11, and WF/EWF of +3, and Epic Prowess of +1, and Halfling +1, so your max AB is 42 (40 when dual-wielding), with that extra +4 when making an AoO from Opportunist - so that's good news!
